name: Cadmium sulphuricum
Relationship: Compare: Cadmium oxide; Cad. brom. (pain and burning in stomach and vomiting); Cadmium jodat. (Itching of anus and rectum felt during the day only; constipation, frequent desire, tenesmus, abdomen bloated); Zinc.; Ars.; Carbo; Verat.
Modalities: Worse: walking or carrying burdens; after sleep; from open air

Mind: Vertigo; room and bed seem to spin around
Stool: Gelatinous, yellowish green; semi-fluid, with urinary suppression
Stomach: Burning and cutting pains in stomach
Vomiting of mucus, green slime, blood, with great prostration, and great tenderness over the stomach
Soreness in pit of stomach on pressure
Abdomen: Black, offensive clots of blood from bowels
Mouth: Intense nausea, with pain and cold
Stringy, offensive exudation on mucous membrane
Head: Hammering in head
Heat in head
Urine: Rawness and soreness in urethra, urine mixed with pus and blood
Sleep: Stops breathing on going to sleep
Fears to go to sleep again
Skin: Chloasma, yellowish stains on nose and cheeks; worse exposure to sun and wind
Throat: Sore throat, constant tickling; gagging and nausea, worse deep breathing; chilliness and aching

details: Its pathogenesis gives symptoms corresponding to very low forms of disease, as in cholera, YELLOW FEVER, where, with exhaustion, vomiting, and EXTREME PROSTRATION, the disease runs death ward. Important gastric symptoms. Carcinoma ventriculi; persistent vomiting. The attack is upon the stomach more especially. Patients must keep quiet. CHILLINESS AND COLDNESS even when near the fire.
